messageBody:
Trevor,

My first instinct would be to write a custom runner. It could look
for methods annotated with @AfterFailure, and only execute them on
failure. I've invented a clever little runner to do just that, but
the margin is too small to contain it. Perhaps later today...

David Saff

On 3/14/07, Trevor Harmon <trevor@...> wrote:
> I'm testing a complicated data structure, and I've written a method
> that prints the structure to the console for debugging purposes. I'd
> like to have this method run automatically if and only if a test
> fails. For instance, I'd like to write something like this:
>
> @After
> public void tearDown()
> {
> if (testFailed())
> printDiagnostics();
> }
>
> Is there some way of doing that? Thanks,
>
> Trevor
